poem:
**Diplomatic Currents**

In Addis, old maps are redrawn  
with handshakes and careful ink,  
where oceans touch and borders blink.  
Past rifts like dried-up rivers flow,  
new dialogues tend the soil below.  
Somalia and Ethiopia cast their nets:  
two nations, mending, calmly reflect  
on futures charted, bridges intact.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
